abstract: Albert Apuzzi and Dori Ten first met in 1988 at famed handball courts in Coney Island, where both had been playing for years, and married five years later; their lives are dictated by handball, from their social life to their vacations; couple has amassed more than two dozen national titles in singles and doubles competition (Series: Summer Love).
lead_paragraph: It was a slow road to love for Albert Apuzzi and Dori Ten, whose story began with a match that was part first date, part first aid. The relationship evolved on the courts and still revolves around the sport.

headline.main: He Carried Her Off the Handball Court, but Didn’t Quite Sweep Her Off Her Feet
headline.print_headline: Carried Off the Court, but Not Swept Off Her Feet

snippet: It was a slow road to love for Albert Apuzzi and Dori Ten, whose story began with a match that was part first date, part first aid. The relationship evolved on the courts and still revolves around the sport.
